page.name: Ability Check
page.content:
Ability Check

Home > Abilities > Ability Check

Success = 1d20 + Ability + (Prof.) ≥ DC

In special circumstances a creature may have advantage or disadvantage on the roll.

* The character must be proficient in the skill in order to add their proficiency bonus to the roll.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 174

page.name: Acrobatics
page.content:
Acrobatics

Home > Abilities > Acrobatics

Acrobatics measures the ability to maintain balance, tumble, and perform tricks in the air.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 176

page.name: Advantage & Disadvantage
page.content:
Advantage & Disadvantage

Home > Abilities > Advantage & Disadvantage
Advantage Roll 2d20 and take the higher of the two rolls.
Disdvantage Roll 2d20 and take the lower of the two rolls.
  • No double advantage or disadvantage.
  • A creature with both has neither.

Note: If something grants a creature the ability to reroll a die, they choose which one to reroll.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 173

page.name: Alternate Abilities
page.content:
Alternate Abilities

Home > Abilities > Alternate Abilities

Depending on the situation, skills may be paired with alternate abilities from their base ability.

Examples
Animal Handling STR Attempting to subdue an animal with brute strength.
Athletics DEX An athletic feat, that requires agility more than strength.
Intimidation STR Using one’s physical presence instead of words to intimidate.
Performance DEX Playing a musical instrument or a intricate dance.
Sleight of Hand INT Something that requires a steady hand and keen mind.
Stealth CHA Blending in at a party or on the street, instead of sneaking.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 175

page.name: Group Check
page.content:
Group Check

Home > Abilities > Group Check

Success = 50% ≥ Check DC

Use group checks when multiple characters are trying to do something as a group like:

  • Sneak past a guard outpost. (stealth)
  • Navigate a dense jungle. (survival)
  • Identify the intentions of a mob. (insight)

MrFarland House Rule
Natural 20 = 2 successes;
Natural 1 = 2 failures.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 175

page.name: Passive Check
page.content:
Passive Check

Home > Abilities > Passive Check

Success = 10 + Ability Mod ≥ DC

Use passive checks to:

  • Perform common tasks without a roll.
  • Make a check without alerting the player.

Advantage & Disadvantage

  • -5 if the player would have disadvantage.

page.name: Concentration
page.content:
Concentration

Home > Spellcasting > Concentration

A caster loses concentration when they:

  • cast another concentration spell,
  • become incapacitated or killed,
  • takes damage from an attack or effect.

CON DC = Higher of (10 or 1/2 DMG)

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 203
